channel.title: Polyphony subpatch not working
channel.description:
I've rewound the youtube basic synthesis tutorial 10 times and can't get the sub-patch working.
create voice view/settings/sub patch mode/ polyphony save voice.axp in new folder create new patch and save in same folder call new object with ./voice
no joy

item.title: Polyphony subpatch not working
item.dc:creator: @edapx Davide Prati
item.description:
@edapx wrote:

I am following the amazing @janvantomme book. Unfortunately the part regarding saving subpatches is not up to date with the current version of the axoloti patcher. I was able to create a subpatch as suggested in this thread, using patch/patcher. But after saving the subpatch with a a name like "myexample" and creating a new patch, i can not find it in the menu. How can I reuse subpatches among patches?

Read full topic

item.title: Polyphony subpatch not working
item.dc:creator: @axoman
item.description:
@axoman wrote:

Thanks Mark, I did spot that video but never watched it cause I'd watched it before I purchased Axoloti and didn't remember any of that polyphony stuff being shown. But yes, that worked, I can see a selector for polyphony directly on the object now.

Regards your Eigenharp videos, funny thing, I realised when watching one of them that your avatar is actually your dog, lol, I originally assumed it was a Polar bear due to your username

Read full topic

item.title: Polyphony subpatch not working
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

axoman:

Yup, have the midi keyboard object in the subpatch, plus an oscillator going to an outlet, that's all is in it!

Do you have a link to the video about polyphony, I can't find it, just demonstrations of the patches.

here:

note: Johannes, create the 'voice patch' first, as he shows it monophonic, then he saves it, and loads it into what becomes the main patch.
this was also before embedded patches, with an embedded patch, you do the same, just you do have to worry about saving the voice patch to disk, and then ensuring you put it all in the sub-directory - so much easier.

btw: if you are using an embedded patch, after you make a change, make sure you hit the update button.

anyway, try with an embedded voice, and if its still not working post it here.
(thats the other advantage of embedded patches, you only end up with one file to share )

Then I looked at your channel and ended-up watching a bunch of your Eigenharp videos instead

yeah, Ive got to stop playing with Axoloti for long enough, that I can make some more videos/music.

Read full topic

item.title: Polyphony subpatch not working
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

the main patch settings have nothing to do with polyphony.

you need to edit the setting on the sub patch (aka voice patch), and change is mode to polyphonic,

Screen Shot 2017-03-07 at 16.48.16.png540x796 191 KB

check the videos/user guide, and tutorials.. these show sub patches/voices so you can see how they are 'constructed'

Read full topic

item.title: Polyphony subpatch not working
item.dc:creator: @axoman
item.description:
@axoman wrote:

How do I set the amount of polyphony for the main patch once I have, say, an osc patch inside that patch?

I followed the original instructions and managed to create a working subpatch without isses, but when I play it, it's still monophonic so I assume there's a setting for it, but I can't find it among the other settings.

Read full topic

item.title: Polyphony subpatch not working
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

use patch/patcher aka embedded patch instead... the videos were made before these existed.
(I think all the demos are now using embedded patches, so you can look for examples there)

as for the example.. the issue you have is probably are having is down to the path of the subpatch... be aware you need to save both the main and subpatch before you compile.
apart from that we would need to see the error, and exactly what you have done.
... anyway as i said, use embedded patches , much better

Read full topic

item.title: Polyphony subpatch not working
item.dc:creator: @DrJustice
item.description:
@DrJustice wrote:

I've found that the demo synth patches with a sub patch need refreshing, probably because I'm running 1.0.8. The procedure is as follows:
- load the synth patch that fails to compile
- open the voice sub patch
- save the voice sub patch (this is the refresh)
- close the synth patch, don't save it
- open the synth patch again and it should compile

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @timvets TimVets
item.description:
@timvets wrote:

In case you mean that it's monophonic; how are you playing the patch?
iirc. midi/in/keyboard object must be inside the polyphonic subpatch for polyphony to work.
I ran into that once or twice...
